intro: Hydrostachys natalensis, commonly known as Natal waterwheel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive whorled arrangement of leaves and small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland areas and is adapted to aquatic or semi-aquatic environments. It has a creeping rootstock and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Hydrostachys natalensis is often used in water gardens and wetland restoration projects due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
